author: Jill Layton
title: Shay Mitchell became an R-rated Belle in this “Beauty and the Beast” parody
text:
Shay Mitchell became an R-rated Belle in this “Beauty and the Beast” parody Beauty and the Beast finally hit theaters last Friday, and spoiler alert, it was just as good as we hoped and dreamed it would be. Something else that’s good (in a different, more grown-up way) is Shay Mitchell’s R-Rated Beauty and the Beast parody — which we just can’t seem to stop watching .
Written and directed by King Bach, the parody is an updated version of the movie we all love . Pretty Little Liars star Mitchell plays Belle — a much sassier, modern-day version of the Belle played by Emma Watson. And the Beast is played by the hilarious King Bach.
The storyline is pretty much the same one we know, where Belle is on a journey to save her father and break the spell of the Enchanted Rose. Except she does it all with a killer sense of humor.
Oh, and some solid cuss words thrown in. The story is complete with Lumiere, the talking candlestick; Mrs. Potts, the teapot; and Chip, the adorable teapot boy. Chip attempts to show Belle one of his tricks, but he ends up accidentally farting instead. Luckily, Belle is compassionate and doesn’t make him feel bad about it, until she does, of course.
The classic dance with Belle and Beast turns into a raging dance party where things turn dirty pretty quickly. Mitchell posted a little behind-the-scenes video of the dance.
“So glad I got to show off the 10+ years of dance classes I took as a child very elegant and classy – video up now! @kingbach #beautyandthebeast,” she wrote. A post shared by Shay Mitchell (@shaym) on Mar 16, 2017 at 5:44pm PDT 
Check out the full parody: We’re pretty happy this exists.
